sql_manager.core package¶

Submodules¶

sql_manager.core.manager module¶

class sql_manager.core.manager.Manager(Base, dbfile=':memory:', echo=False, drop=False, logger=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Database Manager

Parameters

  • Base – Base object created by DynamicModel

  • dbfile – path of database file

  • echo – turn echo on

  • drop – drop table before create

  • logger – a logging object

Examples

>>> from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer
>>> from sql_manager import DynamicModel, Manager
>>> columns = {'uid': Column(Interger, primary_key=True), 'name': Column(String(10), comment='the username')}
>>> Base, Data = DynamicModel('TEST', columns, 'test')
>>> with Manager(Base, dbfile='test.db') as m:
>>>   data = Data(uid=1, name='sqd')
>>>   m.insert(Data, 'uid', data)

sql_manager.core.model module¶

sql_manager.core.model.DynamicModel(name, columns, tablename='data')[source]¶

Create a Base Model

Parameters

  • name – name of model

  • columns – dict of sqlalchemy columns, eg. {‘id’: Column(…)}

  • tablename – name of table
